title: Ensuring Robust Consideration of Evolving National Security Risks by the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States to enhance its review processes to better identify and address evolving national security risks posed by foreign investments. It emphasizes safeguarding critical technologies, supply chains, sensitive data, and cybersecurity from potential threats associated with investments by foreign adversaries or countries of special concern.
potential_concerns: Increased scrutiny may slow down or deter beneficial foreign investments, potentially impacting economic growth.
Determining which foreign entities pose unacceptable risks could lead to inconsistent or subjective decisions.
Expanding review criteria may impose additional compliance costs on businesses and overwhelm the Committeeâ€™s capacity.
The focus on sensitive data and advanced technologies may raise concerns about privacy and trade secrets among companies.
Close collaboration with allies on supply chains could be complicated by differing national security priorities and regulatory frameworks.
